definitions.definition: The inevitable progression into the future with the passing of present and past events.
examples: Time stops for nobody.   the ebb and flow of time

subdefinitions.definition: The feeling of the passage of events and their relative duration, as experienced by an individual.
examples: Time flies when you're having fun.

subdefinitions.definition: A dimension of spacetime with the opposite metric signature to space dimensions; the fourth dimension .
examples: Both science-fiction writers and physicists have written about travel through time .

subdefinitions.definition: Change associated with the second law of thermodynamics ; the physical and psychological result of increasing entropy .
examples: Time slows down when you approach the speed of light.

subdefinitions.definition: The property of a system which allows it to have more than one distinct configuration.
examples: An essential definition of time should entail neither speed nor direction, just change.

subdefinitions.definition: A quantity of availability of duration .
examples: More time is needed to complete the project.   You had plenty of time , but you waited until the last minute.   Are you finished yet? Time ’s up!

subdefinitions.definition: A measurement of a quantity of time; a numerical or general indication of a length of progression.
examples: a long time ;  Record the individual times for the processes in each batch.   Only your best time is compared with the other competitors.   The algorithm runs in O(n ) time .

subdefinitions.definition: The serving of a prison sentence.
examples: The judge leniently granted a sentence with no hard time .   He is not living at home because he is doing time .

subdefinitions.definition: An experience.
examples: We had a wonderful time at the party.

subdefinitions.definition: An era ; (with the , sometimes in the plural) the current era, the current state of affairs.
examples: Roman times ;  the time of the dinosaurs;  how things were at that time ;  how things were in those times

subdefinitions.definition: A person's youth or young adulthood, as opposed to the present day.
examples: In my time , we respected our elders.

subdefinitions.definition: Time out ; temporary, limited suspension of play.
subdefinitions.label_groups: only in singular , sports and figuratively

subdefinitions.definition: The duration of time of a given day that has passed; the moment, as indicated by a clock or similar device.
examples: Excuse me, have you got the time ?   What time is it, do you guess? Ten o’clock?   A computer keeps time using a clock battery.
They will be asleep by this time , don'tcha think?

subdefinitions.definition: A particular moment or hour; the appropriate moment or hour for something (especially with prepositional phrase or imperfect subjunctive).
examples: it’s time for (you to go to) bed;  it’s time to sleep;  we must wait for the right time ;  it's time we were going

subdefinitions.definition: A numerical indication of a particular moment.
examples: at what times do the trains arrive?;  these times were erroneously converted between zones

subdefinitions.definition: An instance or occurrence .
examples: When was the last time we went out? I don’t remember.
see you another time ;  that’s three times he’s made the same mistake
Okay, but this is the last time . No more after that!

subdefinitions.definition: Closing time .
examples: Last call: it's almost time .

subdefinitions.definition: The hour of childbirth .
The end of someone's life, conceived by the speaker as having been predestined .

definitions.definition: The measurement under some system of region of day or moment .
examples: Let's synchronize our watches so we're not on different time .

definitions.definition: A ratio of comparison ( see also usage notes and prepositional sense at ' times ' ).
examples: your car runs three times faster than mine;  that is four times as heavy as this

subdefinitions.definition: Tempo ; a measured rate of movement.
examples: The musician keeps good time .

subdefinitions.definition: Rhythmical division , meter .
examples: common or triple time ; time signature

subdefinitions.definition: A straight rhythmic pattern , free from fills , breaks and other embellishments .
examples: After the introduction, the drummer is to play time .
the time of a verb

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The inevitable progression into the future with the passing of present and past events.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) The measurement under some system of region of day or moment .
( countable ) A ratio of comparison ( see also usage notes and prepositional sense at ' times ' ).
( music , uncountable ) The measured duration of sounds .
( slang , MLE ) Clipping of a long time .
